projects.title: European Workshop Budapest
projects.description:
This project was commissioned by the Contemporary Architectural Centre (KÉK), to gain more insight into the current state of Urban Green Spaces in Budapest. The WUR Budapest consultancy group consisted of 27 students that executed an 8-week research in both Wageningen, The Netherlands and on location in Budapest, Hungary. The report provides data and recommendations per district and also several scenarios and action plans to create a greener living environment in Budapest in cooperation with specific stakeholders. 

The aim of the project was to examine the current situation of UGSs in the city of Budapest, and to provide scenarios to promote the social value of green areas. In the analysis, different tools have been used: questionnaires to citizens (570), expert interviews (21) and observations in parks (28). The data collection focused on five specific districts of Budapest - VII, VIII, IX, XI and XIII. The information collected has been analysed in specific geo-reports.

Different expertises used during this course were; spatial, policy and stakeholder, environment and public health, and scenario analysis.

projects.title: Case studies Cost-Benefit Analysis of Day Forest Djibouti (Horn of Africa)
projects.description:
The course Cost-Benefti Analysis and Environmental Valuation (DEC-31306) contained two theoretical case studies, both about the Day Forest Djibouti in the Horn of Africa. The first contained a project where two different valuation methods (surrogate-market method and changes-in-productivity valuation) had to be implemented to construct the net benefit stream when a project is conducted or not. This project contained the exclusion of grazing animals in the forest and implementing water points to improve the utilization level of the forest and surrounding rangeland. 

The second case study contained the environmental valuation of forest areas, where a recommendation to the government was developed containing whether or not they should enter into the agreement of giving a pharmaceutical company exclusive access to the forest to search for new medicines. This case study used the Willingness To Accept (WTA), income per household, number of household members, amount of fuelwood collection, education level and number of inactive household memebers (obtained from designed questionnaires) to derive the Net Present Value (NPV) of the expected profits of the company and government.

projects.title: Representing Concerned Citizens of Rotterdam harbour during simulation game
projects.description: For the course similation of Environmental Quality and Governance (ENP-35806), my partner and I represented the local citizens of the Rotterdam harbour. During these simulations we had to stress our major concerns about our safety and for future generations. These concerns were because of a disaster occurring, containing contaminated sediments in the harbour and other water en air pollution aspects, caused by other stakeholders. Many participating stakeholders had a stake in the matter and it was very interesting to see them all displaying their own goals but finally trying to come up with a solution together. During the simulation we actively used a blog and twitter to display our concerns, formed coalitions with other stakeholders and also had to present a poster at the end, containing the subject related concepts we got familiar with during the lectures of this course.

contributors.headline: Business Manager Circular Economy bij Port of Rotterdam | MSc. Urban Environmental Management

projects.title: Theoretical essay motivations of people leaving Christchurch, New Zealand, after earthquakes of 2010-2011
projects.description: For the course Natural Hazards and Disasters (SDC-35306), our project group wrote an essay to display the main motivations of people leaving the area of Christchurch, New Zealand, after the big earthquakes of 2010-2011 occurred. Another part of this course was to create a poster to display in a quick overview of our findings, similar to a congress process when there is not much time to present. To obtain results, a literature study was used, substantiated by interview questions sent out to people who experienced the disasters.

projects.title: Restoration Ecology case studies
projects.description:
During the course Restoration Ecology (NCP-30806) 10 different case subjects were covered:
N deposition history and restoration, Former agricultural use and nature development, Restoration flower rich wet grasslands, Forest restoration Panama canal area, Multicriteria analysis, Analysing vegetation changes, Restoring dry riverine grasslands, Lake restoration, Lake restoration in a changing climate, Applying knowledge to other ecosystems (and Ethics of restoration).

projects.title: Deforestation due to soybean production; an analysis of ecological, social and economic impacts on the Amazonian rainforest
projects.description: Our objective for this project was to identify the ecological, social and economic impacts of deforestation due to soybean production on the Amazonian rainforest. This was done by using the tools stakeholder analysis, ecosystem services analysis and scenario analysis, after using the DPSIR method with causal diagram to find the underlying relationships associated to the problem analysis.

profile_positions.description: Ecochain’s Environmental Business Intelligence helps you gain complete control over your environmental performance. Using Ecochains platform, you can measure the environmental impact of your operations, your supply chain, processes, and products. This will provide you with the insights to develop lean & green business cases and circular business models to maximize sustainable growth.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Specialist

profile_positions.description: Benefits of Nature calculates and improves the footprint of companies and their products in the international agriculture and horticulture sector. After that, Benefits of Nature helps entrepreneurs to choose more sustainable suppliers and transporters.
profile_positions.title: LCA specialist

profile_positions.description: Analyzing various tools to measure the biodiversity impact of mining practices and creating an action plan for companies to reduce their environmental impact. Mainly conducted in the tin and aluminium beverage can supply chain.
profile_positions.title: MSc. Intern Supply Chain Analyst

profile_positions.description: This study expands on the problem of the increasing global food demand and the associated impacts of N and P runoff to surface waters, by means of a literature study containing the current N and P inputs, uptakes and use efficiencies.  Furthermore the study contains the further development of the Fast Diet Calculator by focusing on calculating P fertilizer and P manure inputs and the assessment of P losses to surface waters related to the inputs.  And finally, this research will also focus on the global impact of various diet change scenarios (including insects) on N and P flows and their relationship to the N and P losses to surface waters.
profile_positions.title: MSc. ESA thesis; Analysing global effects of changing diets on N and P runoff to surface waters

profile_positions.description: A field study to indicate differences in tree development of endemic tree species based on associated influence factors (variables), in several areas around Ranomafana National Park. Since 1995, Centre ValBio has planted trees to expand the national park and increase the population numbers of different animal species (especially lemur's). The results of this study contributes as a follow-up indication of the forest development. Studied variables include environmental aspects (slope direction and steepness), water availability, management proceedings (weed control),presence of animal species or other plant species. Also a literature study is included to backup the field study.
profile_positions.title: BSc. Final Thesis - Intern researcher
